comments:
Build 20020109 + debug teams latest-plugins

I imported all of the plugins using the plugin import tool.  I could launch
Eclipse and selfhost.  I then deleted the org.eclipse.core.boot plugin and
reimported it as source.  Now whenever I try to launch Eclipse I get the
following exception.

java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.DelegatingURLClassLoader.loadClass(DelegatingURLClassLoader.java:755)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:257)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup(InternalBootLoader.java:914)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:809)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:285)
	at SlimLauncher.main(SlimLauncher.java:14)
Exception in thread "main" 

NOTE:  I can't find the source for the SlimLauncher anywhere (drops, CVS server,
etc).
and another reminder to make the source of SlimLauncher available as part of 
the org.eclipse.pde.selfhost plugin.

I updated the slkimlauncher plugin to contain the SlimLauncher source.
(01/16/02)

As you see, SlimLauncher does nothing that calling BootLoader.startup.
I just tried your scenario, and it was running.
 Imported (copy contents, do not extract source)
   org.apache.xerces
   org.eclipse.core.resources
   org.eclipse.core.runtime
   org.eclipse.help
   org.eclipse.sdk
   org.eclipse.swt
   org.eclipse.ui
Imported (copy contents, do extract source)
  org.eclipse.core.boot

I removed boot.jar to be sure that the compiler source was used.
It's probably not a bug of the launcher, but core.
I close the PR, please reopen if I am wrong.
